<div></div>
</div>
<div>**10% off the regular price of your next In-home repair service (parts and labor). Not applicable to prior purchases or ServiceSmart agreements. Not valid in conjunction with other coupons, tech-add on or preseason specials. One discount per purchase. Present this coupon to receive discount. For Home Services licensing information visit searshomeservices.com. 2011 Sears Brands, LLC. Tech: Enter code H1144. Offer ends 1/31/12.

<sup>1</sup>*IMPORTANT SPECIAL FINANCING/DEFERRED INTEREST DETAILS (when offered); Interest will be charged to your account from the purchase date if the purchase balance is not paid in full within the promotional period or if you make a late payment. Minimum payments required. With credit approval, for qualifying purchases made on a Sears card (Sears Commercial One accounts excluded) Sears Home Improvement Account (sm) valid on installed sales only. Offer is only valid for consumer accounts in good standing; is subject to change without notice; see store for details. May not be combined with any other promotional offer. Sears cards: As of 7/2/2012, APR for purchases: Variable 7.24%-27.24% or non-variable 14.00%-29.99%. Minimum interest charge: up to $2. See card agreement for details, including the APRs and fees applicable to you. Sears cards are issued by Citibank, N.A. +See www.searshomeservices.com/shs/info/satisfaction-guarantee for Satisfaction Guarantee details. Sears Home Improvement Products, Inc. is a division of Sears Roebuck and Co. The Sears Home Services brand logo is used with the permission of Sears, Roebuck and Co.</div>

	<item>
		<title>Shop Your way Rewards</title>
		<link>http://uxint-sears/community/general/shop-your-way-rewards/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 16 Aug 2012 01:21:45 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://uxint-sears/community/?p=78</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div>
<div>Discover New Products with SHOP YOUR WAY</div>
<div>
<div>
<div></div>
<div>Shop an enormous selection of products.</div>
<div></div>
<div>Buy online or in-store and earn points</div>
</div>
<div>
<div></div>
<div>Follow your favorite brands and stores to be the first to see when they announce great deals</div>
</div>
<div>
<div></div>
<div>Read product reviews and recommendations by people with similar interests and tastes</div>
</div>
<div>
<div></div>
<div>Create custom wishlists and catalogs and share them with your friends</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div></div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>Online</div>
<div>Earn Points From Home</div>
<div></div>
<div>While checking out online, simply enter your Member Number in your shopping cart. Every online purchase earns you points. Bonus Points apply to items marked as such during checkout.</div>
<div></div>
<div>Use Points Without Going to the Store</div>
<div></div>
<div>During checkout, enter your Member Number on the Billing page and type your PIN. Remember, it's up to you how many points you want to use for each purchase!</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div>
<div></div>
<div>In-store</div>
<div></div>
<div>Earning
&amp; Redeeming</div>
<div></div>
<div>Earning Points is Easy</div>
<div>
<ul>
	<li>At checkout, flash your Member Number - Voila! Points earned for every purchase.</li>
	<li>If you forgot your Member Number, simply give the associate your phone number or email address.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div>Redeeming Points is Even Easier.
And More Fun!</div>
<div>
<ul>
	<li>At checkout, have the associate tell you your Points balance. No number handy? Use your phone number or email address.</li>
	<li>Enter your Member PIN in the register keypad when prompted.</li>
	<li>Let the associate know how many points you want to use for your purchase. Remember, every 1,000 Points = $1.</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Cameras and Camcorders</title>
		<link>http://uxint-sears/community/electronics/cameras-and-camcorders/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 16 Aug 2012 01:23:18 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://uxint-sears/community/?p=81</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div>
<h2>Camera and Camcorder Lenses Are Important Accessories</h2>
&nbsp;
<div><a title="AmandaBryant" href="http://www.mysears.com/aboutme/AmandaBryant" rel="noindex,nofollow"><img src="http://www.mysears.com/images/review/2011/306/17/1320273137-6828852_cropped.jpg?1320273153" alt="photo of AmandaBryant" /></a>
<div><a href="http://www.mysears.com/aboutme/AmandaBryant">AmandaBryant</a> Evanston, IL</div>
<div></div>
</div>
<div>

Investing in a quality HD camcorder is a wonderful way to capture and preserve family memories. Sears.com now offers a variety of <a title="camcorder accessories" href="http://www.sears.com/computers-electronics-cameras-camcorders-accessories/s-1022202"> camcorder accessories</a> to support, protect and enhance your new camcorder so that you never miss a smile, a first or any treasured moment that comes along.

The most important accessory you can purchase is a durable <a title="camcorder case" href="http://www.sears.com/computers-electronics-cameras-camcorders-accessories&amp;Bags%20aMpeRd%20cases/s-1022202?filter=Accessory%20Type&amp;viewType=gal&amp;viewItems=25"> camcorder case</a>. Whether you choose a soft bag, a hard pack or one that glides on wheel is mostly a personal preference. Just be sure to look for a product that provides protection on the top and bottom so that the camcorder will be protected if the bag is dropped. You will also want something that is weather resistant, especially if you will be setting off on outdoor adventures. It is also crucial that the inside is made from scratch resistant material.

A quality case should also come equipped with enough storage pockets and divider sections to carry and organize all the various camcorder accessories, including an adapter, a charger, extra batteries, a cable connector, memory cards or DVDs and cleaning materials. If you choose a smaller case with a carrying handle, make sure it has a secure clip. <a title="Tamrac" href="http://www.sears.com/search=tamrac+camcorder+case?vName=Computers+%26+Electronics&amp;cName=Cameras+%26+Camcorders&amp;viewItems=25&amp;autoRedirect=true"> Tamrac</a>, which began manufacturing carrying cases in 1977, is one of the most trusted names in the industry.

Even the steadiest hands can make a recording appear jumpy on playback. If you plan to record for more than five minutes, your camcorder should have a screw plate on the bottom that makes it capable of being mounted to a <a title="tripod" href="http://www.sears.com/computers-electronics-cameras-camcorders-accessories&amp;Tripods/s-1022202?filter=Accessory%20Type&amp;viewType=gal&amp;viewItems=25"> tripod</a> Swivel C-clamps and small, pidertripods that are made to sit on a tabletop can be purchased for just a few dollars. Larger tripods, which can stand up to five feet when the legs are extended, will fold down to a very manageable two feet so that it can be stored neatly in the carrying bag.

Other important accessories you might need before heading out to an event include a video light, a microphone and a remote switch. Even for the hobbyist, extended <a title="lenses and filters " href="http://www.sears.com/computers-electronics-cameras-camcorders-accessories&amp;Lenses%20aMpeRd%20filters/s-1022202?filter=Accessory%20Type&amp;viewType=gal&amp;viewItems=25"> lenses and filters</a> that mount to the front of the camcorder will make a dramatic difference in the footage you shoot. A clear protective filter can prevent damages and smudges, a polarizing filter will reduce the glare that is caused by bright lights, while a color correction filter will enhance the dominate shade in the scene. Additional adaptors are available in wide-angle and long-range telephoto lenses.

Your new camcorder will also benefit from quality <a title="cleaning and maintenance " href="http://www.sears.com/computers-electronics-cameras-camcorders-accessories&amp;Cleaning%20aMpeRd%20maintenance/s-1022202?filter=Accessory%20Type&amp;viewItems=25"> cleaning and maintenance</a> products, including silica gels packs that will prevent moisture, mildew and mold, a non-abrasive cleaning solution and soft cloth, as well as a scratch repair kit and a blower brush.

</div>
</div>]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Home Office</title>
		<link>http://uxint-sears/community/general/home-office/</link>

		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://uxint-sears/community/?p=83</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<h2>Home Office</h2>
<h2></h2>
<h2><a title="Permanent Link to Clean and Wonderful. Id Love to Work Here." href="http://home.officesnapshots.com/2011/09/27/clean-and-wonderful-id-love-to-work-here/" rel="bookmark">Clean and Wonderful. Id Love to Work Here.</a></h2>
<div>
<div><a href="http://home.officesnapshots.com/2011/09/27/clean-and-wonderful-id-love-to-work-here/"><img src="http://home.officesnapshots.com/wp-content/uploads/yapb_cache/5667022652_37492784bd_b.dhwttkqweyo0go4cssks8w080.bc67xig3hwgk4kog4so80ssks.th.jpeg" alt="Clean and Wonderful. I'd Love to Work Here." width="500" height="333" /></a></div>
</div>
<div>
<div></div>
<h2><a title="Permanent Link to In Inspiring View To Say The Least" href="http://home.officesnapshots.com/2011/09/26/in-inspiring-view-to-say-the-least/" rel="bookmark">In Inspiring View To Say The Least</a></h2>
<div>
<div><a href="http://home.officesnapshots.com/2011/09/26/in-inspiring-view-to-say-the-least/"><img src="http://home.officesnapshots.com/wp-content/uploads/yapb_cache/3653481104_c0114e35a0_b.5p6pshj3kmo8owc8g4088c04s.bc67xig3hwgk4kog4so80ssks.th.jpeg" alt="In Inspiring View To Say The Least" width="500" height="377" /></a></div>
from <a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/wmeissner/3653481104/sizes/l/in/photostream/">flickr</a>.

</div>
</div>
<div>
<div></div>
<h2><a title="Permanent Link to My Dream Setup." href="http://home.officesnapshots.com/2011/08/15/my-dream-setup/" rel="bookmark">My Dream Setup.</a></h2>
<div>
<div><a href="http://home.officesnapshots.com/2011/08/15/my-dream-setup/"><img src="http://home.officesnapshots.com/wp-content/uploads/yapb_cache/tumblr_lmgv9xptex1qa8vdgo1_500.5znjo42vz10cgkg084csscowo.bc67xig3hwgk4kog4so80ssks.th.jpeg" alt="My Dream Setup." width="467" height="640" /></a></div>

</div>

	<item>
		<title>Home Theater</title>
		<link>http://uxint-sears/community/general/home-theater/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 15 Aug 2012 20:24:15 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://uxint-sears/community/?p=85</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div>
<h2>Home Theater and Audio Systems Keep You Rockin'</h2>
Stereo systems offer an easy way to enjoy music and radio. The term is applies to both multi-function stereo units with included speakers and audio component systems which require a more involved setup. Stereo systems can be portable or designed to provide the best possible sound quality in any environment. With stereos from brands like Crosley, Sony and RCA, finding the perfect system is easy with Sears.

Typical stereo systems have a CD player, radio and other components such as cassette decks. Many newer systems have audio in jacks, which can be useful for playing audio from an mp3 player or other audio device. <a title="docking stereo systems" href="http://www.sears.com/search=docking+stereo+system?vName=">Docking stereo systems</a> can play audio from mp3 players while charging them, but most docking stereo systems are designed to work with Apple's iPod and iPhone due to the popularity of those devices.

<a title="home audio component systems" href="http://www.sears.com/search=home+audio+component?vName=">Home audio component systems</a> consist of several separate components that are connected together to provide a home stereo. The components of these systems can include dedicated CD players, radios, equalizers and usually a receiver which controls the volume and output of each component. Audio component systems can be expanded easily and can provide better stereo sound, as speakers can be placed at the best possible locations in a room for true stereo representation. Some audio component systems are also surround sound capable.

For a nostalgic music player with modern features, a <a title="turntable stereo" href="http://www.sears.com/search=turntable+stereo?vName=">turntable stereo</a> system is a great choice. These stereos often have built in CD players, radios and tape decks in addition to a quality turntable for playing various vinyl formats, including 45s and LPs. The vintage design of turntable stereos makes them a great complement to any room, and as turntable stereos are often all-in-one units with included speakers, they make great secondary stereos.

<a title="boom boxes" href="http://www.sears.com/search=boom%20box?vName=Computers%20%26%20Electronics&amp;cName=Portable%20Electronics">Boom boxes</a> and CD shelf stereo systems are designed specifically for portability. They're smaller than many hi-fi stereo systems and output less sound. Even so, boom boxes are certainly loud enough to fill a small room, and while they may not be ideal as a home's sole stereo, they're useful for playing music outdoors and for private listening.

Stereo systems range greatly in capabilities, both in terms of the type of media that they play and the quality and volume of their output. Sears offers a strong selection of stereos to fit any type of room and to meet the needs of any audio fan.

</div>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Ellipticals Trainers Build Stamina, Endurance and a Strong Cardiovascular System</title>
		<link>http://uxint-sears/community/fitness-sports/ellipticals/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 16 Aug 2012 01:24:58 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://uxint-sears/community/?p=87</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div>
<div>You can use elliptical trainers to improve your health. NordicTrack and Sole trainers help you tone your body, burn calories and increase your cardiovascular health. At Sears, you can find hundreds of ellipticals and accessories to build your endurance and stamina.</div>
<div>

The use of elliptical trainers takes the stress off your feet as you walk. Jogging and speed-walking can cause pain in your lower body, especially the heels and arches of your feet. If you do suffer from heel pain from constant walking, you can relieve the pain by using a Fellowes or JB International <a title="Foot Rockers" href="http://www.sears.com/search=foot+rockers?vName=">foot rocker</a>. Use the rocker to stretch your foot and to reduce heel, arch and lower body pain.

In fact, you should stretch your muscles before engaging in any activity on the elliptical. Using a <a title="Bean Exercisers" href="http://www.sears.com/search=bean+exercisers?vName=Fitness+%26+Sports&amp;viewItems=25&amp;autoRedirect=true&amp;prop17=bean%20exercisers">bean exerciser</a>, you can effectively stretch all of the muscles in your body with a few simple routines. Stretching before a workout can reduce the risk of muscle injuries such as rips, tears and pulls.

<a title="Elliptical Mats" href="http://www.sears.com/search=elliptical+mats?vName=Fitness+%26+Sports&amp;viewItems=25&amp;autoRedirect=true&amp;prop17=elliptical%20mats">Elliptical mats</a> are useful because they create an extra cushion between you, the machine and the floor. In addition, a Kamway or SportsArt bike mat keeps the elliptical from slipping as you exercise, and it also prevents the machine from scratching the floor.

Elliptical trainers are important machines for any workout room. To get the maximum results from your workout, you need the right elliptical and accessories. Shop Sears for affordable elliptical trainers and supplies to give you an edge in your training.

</div>
</div>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Other Fitness Equipment</title>
		<link>http://uxint-sears/community/fitness-sports/other-fitness-equipment-and-sports/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 16 Aug 2012 01:26:20 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://uxint-sears/community/?p=89</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div>
<h1>Get in Shape with Fitness Equipment from Sears</h1>
<div><a title="SHC-JennaL" href="http://www.mysears.com/aboutme/SHC-JennaL" rel="noindex,nofollow"><img src="http://www.mysears.com/images/review/2011/66/13/1299525185-96912_cropped.jpg?1322230343" alt="photo of SHC-JennaL" /></a>
<div><a href="http://www.mysears.com/aboutme/SHC-JennaL">SHC-JennaL</a> Hoffman Estates, IL</div>
</div>
<div>

Whether you prefer working out first thing in the morning or after work and dinner, incorporating physical fitness into a daily routine can be a lifesaver. With 1,440 minutes in each day and your own fitness equipment from Sears, you can always find 30 minutes to burn calories, build muscle tone and enhance your overall fitness.

Physical activity such as walking on a treadmill, pedaling on a stationary bike or engaging in strength training with a weight bench can benefit a body's overall health. According to the National Institutes of Health, regular physical activity can reduce the risk for cardiovascular disease and osteoporosis as well as increase metabolism and help with weight loss.

Sears offers a wide selection of fitness equipment from NordicTrack, ProForm, Sole, Bowflex, Razor, Weider, Schwinn, Horizon Fitness and more. Fitness equipment from Sears includes treadmills, elliptical trainers, exercise cycles, rowers, steppers, strength and weight training machines, inversion tables and various fitness accessories.

<strong>Treadmills:</strong> Ideal for walking or running, a home treadmill from Sears is great for cold or rainy days. Consider products from ProForm and NordicTrack, both brands offer multiple styles including treadmills with programmable fitness routines.

<strong>Elliptical trainers:</strong> An elliptical trainer can be easier on the knees than a treadmill and it offers a fantastic cardio workout. Look for products such as the NordicTrack AudioStrider 990 Pro Elliptical that feature electronic programming, heart monitors and padded foot pedals for optimum comfort.

<strong>Rowers:</strong> A common piece of fitness equipment at many gyms, now you can have a rower at home! Select a rower from LifeSpan Fitness, Sunny Health, Kettler Fitness or Stamina. Each home rower offers a great way to work both the upper body and legs.

<strong>Steppers:</strong> Work your leg muscles and get in some great cardio with steppers from NordicTrack, Stamina and Body Tone, which offers a mini-stepper ideal for limited spaces.

<strong>Strength and weight training machines:</strong> From home gym stations to dumbbells and body weights, Sears has the fitness equipment you need to build strength and tone muscle. Consider a home gym from Weider or Boxflex.

<strong>Inversion tables:</strong> An inversion table from Body Flex or Ironman can help reduce back pain. As you hang upside down from the inversion table, gravity goes to work realigning the back and relieving back discomfort.

<strong>Fitness accessories:</strong> Check out our selection of exercise mats, gym bags, health monitors and running accessories such as the Walking Advantage Talking Calorie Counter Pedometer.

Sears' selection of home fitness equipment also includes outdoor sports equipment from basketball hoops to camping gear, bikes, scooters and more. We have indoor games covered too, including a variety of gaming tables. Don't forget we offer protection plans and our Blue Crew is available online or by phone to answer any questions.

</div>
</div>]]></content:encoded>

<div>

Advertisement

</div>
<div>
<h2><strong>Fitness Equipment: Treadmills</strong></h2>
Whether you are an exercise enthusiast who prefers to have a gym full of equipment right in your home, or you are just hoping to kick-start your own weight loss journey, there is plenty to know about buying <strong>treadmills</strong>. These popular pieces of exercise equipment are designed to help people burn calories, lose weight and do so in the best way for themselves. Before purchasing a <strong>treadmill</strong>, evaluate what features you would like and what your fitness goals are.

It is important to research the various components treadmills can have. It is easy to get lost in the jargon and precise terminology that only fitness experts might know off-hand. The basic components of a treadmill that you should be aware of include the motor, flywheel frame, rollers, deck, belt, electronics, display console and optional features.

The motor is one of the most important parts of a treadmill to analyze. The motor powers the belt system, allowing you to operate the machine. Motors come in a variety of sizes from 1.5 horsepower to 3 horsepower. It is recommended that you get a treadmill with at least 2 horsepower, to ensure that less time and money will be spent on breakdowns and repairs. Not having enough horsepower could lead to the belt overheating and ultimately breaking down.

Another item to consider is the flywheel. The flywheel helps to regulate the speed of the belt, as well as the belt's consistency. Equipment with a good flywheel will have a constant speed and longer life.

Treadmill frames are usually created out of two types of materials, either steel or aluminum. A steel frame will work well for most purposes, but there are several benefits to owning a model with an aluminum frame. Treadmills with aluminum frames typically have superior strength and will support users of a higher weight, usually up to 500 pounds.

Be sure to observe what types of rollers each piece of equipment has. Good rollers should be heavier and larger, as they support the belt. A set of good rollers will prevent wear and tear on the belt over time, and ultimately improve the lifespan of the treadmill itself.

The deck is an important feature to look at, particularly if you plan on exercising on a regular basis. The deck absorbs the shock of the runner on the treadmill, and provides support.

Another important aspect to consider is the running surface length and width. For instance, a regular runner might want to consider purchasing a treadmill with a belt between 18 inches wide and 55 inches long. This will ensure you get the best results while working out.

The final design aspect to consider is the electronics and display console. This is the part that shows you how long you have run, how many calories you have burned and other important tidbits of information that will help you create the right exercise plan for your needs.

Along with the above mentioned features to be aware of, there are many other options that can be included on your treadmill. These include: internet browsing while you exercise, a sound system to make your workout more enjoyable, folding models to free up space when not in use, iFit Live compatibility, and more.

When purchasing a treadmill, the staff at Sears will be sure to help you fully understand the variety of different components that go into each piece of equipment. By understanding what your needs are in terms of fitness, and what aspects will fit into your budget, you will be sure to have a successful experience picking out the perfect treadmill.

</div>
&nbsp;

		<title>Plans for Memorial Day Weekend</title>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div>
<h1>Plans for Memorial Day Weekend</h1>
I'm just spending a nice quiet weekend in the country, 'Course since I live in the country, I enjoy every day in the country! I have been surprised at how much the price of gas has declined here at a holiday. Locally it is $3.40 a gal. That's about a 50 cent drop in about two months. I generally stay pretty close to home on holidays and do any traveling at other times. Friday I drove about five miles on the interstate near the house and it looked like rush hour in the city!

</div>]]></content:encoded>

<div><a href="http://www.mysears.com/aboutme/lindiloo">lindiloo</a> Glen Ellyn, IL posts: 278 <a href="http://www.mysears.com/help#levels" rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.mysears.com/mysears/images/features/badges/2012_contributors_circle_2.png?e550bee?e550bee?e550bee" alt="2012 Contributors Circle " /></a></div>
</div>
</div>
<div>posted on March 26, 2012 at 08:56PM <a href="http://www.mysears.com/discussion_boards/Community/topics/Gas-Prices-1/posts#">Inappropriate?</a> <img src="http://www.mysears.com/images/comment_tail.gif?e550bee" alt="" /></div>
<div>
<div>

How much do you pay for gas? My local gas station is now selling gas for $4.55 a gallon. Yesterday, I dropped my son off at college and was able to fill up on Highway 57, about 100 miles away for $3.84. That seems like a mighty big difference.

</div>
</div>

<div></div>
<strong>The price of crude could be as cheap as one dollar a barrell upon tapping uncharted fields in Iraq. Perhaps, it is a bit scarey to think of a revolutionary guard actually allowing a muslim shiite population an advantage over Iran. Sunni's could trade water if Austria would give them a glass with ice and I'm sure gas could be cheaper folks, but to often sustainable society's take more time than what is anticipated. 2018 seems like a long way into the future for most but when your incorperating a commodity which the world depends on its a few hours from now. Foreign policy develops at a slugs pace when she wants to move forward..... I suppose on a local level, vendors have "fixed" prices.</strong>

<div>
<div></div>
<strong>Another way to look at the cost of fuel for your car is to compare it to coffee. This is by far my favorite anylogy, in 1993 regular was around .95 cents a gallon while super was 1.15 a gallon. We use to pump gas, (between the flux of traffic), and fetch a cup of jo from wawa for roughly the cost of one gallon. Now, you may say, those days are so far gone but I challenge you to do the math. Those days could be coming back! My problem is the fact that starbucks is my choice to get up and go... (and wawa now gives me bad gas). Some say America runs on Dunkin; however, we are failing to see equality with the arabic bean.</strong>

</div>
</div>

<div>
<div></div>
Wait until you are paying the same sort of prices that the Europeans, and a few other nations are paying. I know a large proportion of the European prices are taxes but again wait untilthe political leaders,ortheir successors, realise that their is a largely untapped tax goldmine 'out there'.

One other thing approximately 30% of US oil imports come from Canada and Mexico, one of these days those two nations are going to wake up and realise they could get more for their oil on the world wide market than by selling it to their neighbour. There is currently about a $20/barrel premium on the 'Brent Crude' benchmark than on the WTI bench mark. I know there are other factors 'out there' but that is, in my opinion, a real big one.

</div>
</div>
</div>

	<item>
		<title>Lawn and Garden Care</title>
		<link>http://uxint-sears/community/general/lawn-and-garden-care/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 16 Aug 2012 01:29:40 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://uxint-sears/community/?p=98</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div>For years, most of us have dutifully applied<a href="http://www.kmart.com/shc/s/p_10151_10104_015V002112729000P?vName=Beauty&amp;cName=Sun+Care&amp;sName=Sunscreen&amp;prdNo=3&amp;blockNo=3&amp;blockType=G3&amp;sid=MMLxarticlexmerch" target="_blank">sunscreen</a>before heading outdoors, confident that we were doing the right thing to<a href="http://www.managemylife.com/mmh/projects/avoid_skin_damage?intcmp=clink">protect our skin</a>from sunburn, premature aging and skin cancer. But research is casting doubt on the ability of sunscreens to do much more than stop sunburn, and some studies have found that ingredients in certain sunscreens might actually lead to greater sun damage.</div>
Knowing what to look for in sunscreen  and what to avoid  can help you find a product that protects your skin without unwanted side effects.
<h2>Truths about Sunscreen</h2>
<img src="http://www.mysears.com/managed_images/8572/original/sunscreen.JPG?1341870709" alt="" width="170" height="255" />

Yes, sunscreen prevents sunburn, but, surprisingly, that's about it, according to recent research. Here are the facts to counter some common misconceptions:

<strong>Sunscreens aren't proven to prevent skin cancer or premature aging</strong>. A<a href="http://www.fda.gov/OHRMS/DOCKETS/98fr/07-4131.htm" target="_blank">2007 Food and Drug Administration (FDA) review of scientific literature</a>led the agency to conclude that "FDA does not believe, as a whole, that the studies demonstrate that sunscreens alone help prevent skin aging or skin cancer."

<strong>SPF numbers above 50 aren't reliable</strong>. The same 2007 FDA report found that SPF ratings greater than 50 are misleading because tests are inconclusive as to whether they block out a higher percentage of the sun's rays than lower-rated products. The FDA took a similar position in 1999 about SPFs higher than 30, until results demonstrated that SPF ratings between 30 and 50 were reliable.

<strong>Some sunscreen ingredients can promote skin damage</strong>. FDA research has shown that vitamin A, when exposed to sunlight, can increase the development of tumors in test animals. Vitamin A is a common ingredient in sunscreens because it decreases the signs of aging.

In addition, some sunscreen ingredients release skin-damaging free radicals as the ingredients break down. Using enough sunscreen and reapplying helps prevent this problem, but few people use enough sunscreen, or reapply often enough.

<strong>A little sun without sunscreen is good for you</strong>. Sunlight reacts with a pigment in the skin to produce vitamin D, a process that sunscreen seems to inhibit. Vitamin D is essential to good health  it strengthens bones and the immune system, among other benefits. The best way to get enough vitamin D is under debate in the medical community, but the American Medical Association recommends exposing the skin to 10 minutes a day of sun without sunscreen.
<h2>What to Avoid in Sunscreen</h2>
The<a href="http://www.ewg.org/2010sunscreen/" target="_blank">2010 Sunscreen Guide</a>by the Environmental Working Group found that only 39 of the 1,400 sunscreens it evaluated provided protection against<a href="http://www.managemylife.com/mmh/questions/190958-whats-the-difference-between-uvb-radiation-and-uva-radiation?intcmp=clink">UVA and UVB rays</a>and contained no ingredients the group considers unsafe.
<h3>Ingredients</h3>
Watch out for these unsafe ingredients:

<strong>Oxybenzone</strong>has been linked to allergies, hormone disruption and cell damage.

<strong>Vitamin A</strong>has been linked to skin cancer. You might see it listed as retinyl palmitate, which is a synthetic form of vitamin A.

<strong>Insect repellent.</strong>The chemicals that make sunscreens penetrate the skin also allow the pesticides in insect repellent to be absorbed. If you absolutely need insect repellent, apply it separately after the sunscreen dries.
<h3>Formulation</h3>
Sprays and powders (such as cosmetic powders) disperse particles into the air, where you can inhale them. Even sunscreen ingredients that are safe when applied as a cream  such as zinc oxide and titanium dioxide  can be hazardous when inhaled.
<h3>SPF</h3>
Until the FDA determines that ratings over SPF 50 are reliable, stick to something between 30 and 50.
<h2>What You Want in Sunscreen</h2>
<img src="http://content.managemyhome.com/Images/articles/sunscreen-and-hat.jpg" alt="Sun protection" width="190" border="0" />
<h3>Ingredients</h3>
Choose ingredients that protect against UVA rays, which have been linked to premature aging and skin cancer, as well as UVB, which cause burning. Those ingredients include the minerals zinc oxide and titanium dioxide, which sit on the skin rather than being absorbed; avobenzone; and Mexoryl SX, which isn't widely used.
<h3>Formulation</h3>
A cream, gel or stick formulation is safer than a spray or powder because there's less risk of inhaling the product.
<h3>SPF</h3>
The SPF rating indicates how well a sunscreen deflects UVB rays. SPF 15 filters out 93 percent of the UVB rays; SPF 30 filters 97percent; and SPF 50 filters 98 percent.

Most dermatologists recommend using at least SPF 30, year round.
<h2>Getting the Most from Your Sunscreen</h2>
<strong>Apply early</strong>. Apply sunscreen about half an hour before sun exposure, so the sunscreen has time to bind to the skin.

<strong>Use enough</strong>. Most people don't apply nearly enough sunscreen. The recommended amount is 1 ounce for an average-sized adult. That's about as much as a shot glass holds.

<strong>Reapply often</strong>. Don't let that SPF 50 make you complacent about reapplying. Even a waterproof sunscreen wears off if you sweat or swim. Reapply a full amount at least every two hours. If you're swimming or sweating a lot, reapply more often.
<h2>Sun Protection Beyond Sunscreen</h2>
Don't get the idea that you should cut out sunscreen all together. Choose sunscreen wisely and remember that it isnt the only sun protection you need. Here is a list of other things to do to protect yourself from the sun:

<strong>Wear protective clothing</strong>. It may be summer, but wearing lightweight long-sleeved shirts and pants helps block the sun's UV rays. A large-brimmed hat protects your face.

<strong>Relax in the shade</strong>. Either find natural shade under a tree or make your own with an umbrella or canopy.

<strong>Don't go out in peak sun hours</strong>. Avoid the sun between the hours of 10 am and 2 pm, when the sun is directly overhead. The best time to be outdoors is either in the early morning or the late afternoon, when the sun is lower in the sky.

<strong>Always wear sunglasses</strong>. Get<a href="http://www.managemylife.com/mmh/questions/156353-expensive-sunglasses-cheap-ones?intcmp=clink">sunglasses</a>that block UV rays to protect your eyes when outdoors and when driving. Not only does squinting cause wrinkles, but UV rays can cause cataracts.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Mowers, Tractors, and power equipment</title>
		<link>http://uxint-sears/community/general/mowers-tractors-and-power-equipment/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 15 Aug 2012 20:30:13 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://uxint-sears/community/?p=100</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div style="text-align: left"><a href="http://uxint-sears/community/files/2012/08/lawn-care.jpg"><img class="alignleft  wp-image-349" src="http://uxint-sears/community/files/2012/08/lawn-care-230x300.jpg" alt="Sears Lawn Cares" width="136" height="178" /></a></div>
<div style="text-align: left"></div>
<div style="text-align: left"></div>
<div style="text-align: left"></div>
<div style="text-align: left"></div>
<div style="text-align: left"></div>
<div style="text-align: left"></div>
<div style="text-align: left"></div>
<div style="text-align: left"></div>
<div style="text-align: left"></div>
<div style="text-align: left"></div>
<div style="text-align: left">For years, most of us have dutifully applied<a href="http://www.kmart.com/shc/s/p_10151_10104_015V002112729000P?vName=Beauty&amp;cName=Sun+Care&amp;sName=Sunscreen&amp;prdNo=3&amp;blockNo=3&amp;blockType=G3&amp;sid=MMLxarticlexmerch" target="_blank">sunscreen</a>before heading outdoors, confident that we were doing the right thing to<a href="http://www.managemylife.com/mmh/projects/avoid_skin_damage?intcmp=clink">protect our skin</a>from sunburn, premature aging and skin cancer. But research is casting doubt on the ability of sunscreens to do much more than stop sunburn, and some studies have found that ingredients in certain sunscreens might actually lead to greater sun damage.</div>
<p style="text-align: left">Knowing what to look for in sunscreen  and what to avoid  can help you find a product that protects your skin without unwanted side effects.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1</title>
		<link>http://uxint-sears/community/general/samsung-galaxy-note/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 20 Aug 2012 09:01:52 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://uxint-sears/community/?p=266</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<h1>Review: Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 tablet is mightier with pen</h1>
<div>
<div>
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tbody>
<tr valign="bottom">
<td></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>
<div><img src="http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/dam/assets/120816033416-samsung-galaxy-note-tablet-story-top.jpg" alt="Reviewer says that the stylus pen on the Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 tablet is its key defining feature" width="575" height="323" border="0" /></div>
<div>
<div>Reviewer says that the stylus pen on the Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 tablet is its key defining feature</div>
</div>
&nbsp;
<div>
<div>
<div><strong>STORY HIGHLIGHTS</strong></div>
<ul>
	<li>On the Saumsung Galaxy Note 10.1 tablet, the stylus pen is the key</li>
	<li>Android tablet has apps specifically designed for the pen</li>
	<li>A 32GB version, with card bringing it to 64GB, is $570; 64GB iPad is $699</li>
	<li>Pen app still not convenient for taking notes, reviewer says</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
<strong>(Sears.com)</strong> -- When Samsung's <a href="http://techland.time.com/2012/02/22/samsung-galaxy-note-review-living-with-a-gigantic-smartphone/" target="_blank">Galaxy Note smartphone</a> went on sale in the U.S. in February, two things made it, um, noteworthy. At 5.3, its display was the largest one ever offered on a phone. And the Note came with Samsung's S Pen, a precision stylus which let you jot notes and sketch pictures without jabbing at the screen with your finger.

Let's face it, though -- that humongous screen completely overshadowed the S Pen. Everyone had a strong opinion about it. Many people found the notion of a phone with a screen that edges in on tablet territory alluring: Samsung says it's shipped ten million Galaxy Notes to date. Others, however, considered that same notion to be comical rather than practical. (Held to the ear, the jumbo-sized Note tends to throw off proportions and make it look like your skull has shrunk by a size or two.)

Now Samsung is releasing its second Galaxy Note device, <a href="http://www.samsung.com/global/microsite/galaxynote/note_10.1/index.html?type=find" target="_blank">the Galaxy Note 10.1</a>, which goes on sale in the U.S. Thursday. This Note, unlike its smartphone sibling, shouldn't be an object of controversy.

<a href="http://techland.time.com/2012/02/10/the-12-best-android-widgets-for-2012/?iid=tl-article-mostpop1#bring-your-home-screen-to-life" target="_blank">The 12 Best Android Widgets for 2012</a>

There's nothing startling about its form factor: It's an Android tablet with a 10.1 display, a size that's comfortably familiar in the Android world, and not radically dissimilar from the 9.7-incher on Apple's iPad. But it's a solid, straightforward Android tablet that comes with an S Pen, a suite of pen-friendly apps and some productivity-oriented software enhancements which give it a more businesslike flavor than Samsung's Galaxy Tab 2 10.1.

&nbsp;
<div><img src="http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/dam/assets/120809033604-inocencio-samsung-ipad-killer-00002724-story-body.jpg" alt="" width="214" height="120" border="0" /><cite>Samsung unveils iPad killer?</cite></div>
<a name="em2"></a>
<div><img src="http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnn/dam/assets/120731045140-apple-samsung-patent-court-battle-story-body.jpg" alt="" width="214" height="120" border="0" /><cite></cite></div>
<div><cite>Apple, Samsung patent feud</cite></div>
The Galaxy Note 10.1 with 16GB of storage lists for $499, the same price as a 16GB iPad. But the 32GB Galaxy Note is $549, $50 less than a 32GB iPad. And while there's no 64GB model, the tablet's microSD slot lets you add a 32GB memory card for $20 or less, bringing capacity up to 64GB for a grand total of about $570 -- a steep discount off the 64GB iPad's $699 sticker price. Both the 16GB and 32GB variants offer wi-fi but no cellular option and come with 50GB of Dropbox online storage for two years.

If the Note 10.1 sells well, it won't be on the strength of the bang it delivers for your buck. It'll be because it's one of the relatively few Android tablets with a snappy answer to the bottom-line question "Why should somebody buy this instead of an iPad?"

The iPad doesn't come with a pen and may never do so, given Steve Jobs' famous declaration that "if you see a stylus, they blew it." Scads of companies have stepped in to fill the gap -- my favorite iPad stylus is Adonit's Jot Flip -- but all of their designs suffer from the fact that they're designed to work with a tablet that was engineered for fingertips.

Samsung, however, built the Galaxy Note 10.1 from the ground up for pen use. And when it decided to add pens to some of its devices, it made the eminently sensible decision to work with Wacom, the company which dominates the market for graphics tablets used by artists.

The S Pen, which stows in a slot on tablet's side when not in use, is based on Wacom's technology. That means that it's pressure-sensitive and extremely precise, and doesn't use a battery. Using it feels like writing with a slightly stubby ballpoint; Samsung also sells a larger pen, as well as one with an "eraser" on the opposite end from the nib.

<a href="http://www.cnn.com/2012/08/16/tech/gaming-gadgets/congo-blood-phones-report/index.html" target="_blank">Tech companies make progress on 'blood phones'</a>

Android doesn't come with any apps meant expressly for pen use. So Samsung created some of its own, including S Note, a highly capable note-taking program which lets you write and draw on simulated lined pages, graph paper and blank sheets. You can use a fine-line pen, a pencil, a paintbrush or a highlighter; pressure sensitivity lets you vary your pen strokes or lay down a thicker coat of paint by pressing harder.

S Note can also convert your block-letter or cursive input into editable text. It did a surprisingly accurate job of deciphering my chicken scratchings. But as with every other device I've ever used with handwriting recognition, the payoff didn't seem worth the effort required: You need to write words a few at a time, then pause while the tablet interprets them. Except for brief notes, if you want to see your words in a crisp, legible typeface rather than your own handwriting, you're probably best off using the on-screen keyboard. (Samsung sells a case, obviously inspired by the iPad's Smart Cover, which lets you angle the tablet for comfy typing.)

Unlike the iPad, the Galaxy Note 10.1 is designed to let you rest your palm on the screen as you write or draw without getting confused by the fact that two parts of your hand are in contact with the display at once. Despite this, I found myself occasionally triggering actions unintentionally as I worked.

I suspect that the fact I'm a southpaw doesn't help: When I begin to write on the left-hand side of the screen, my palm rests on top of Android's on-screen buttons for tasks such as going back one screen and returning to the home screen. A righty's palm would fall in a less critical spot.

The S Pen works in other apps besides S Note, of course. I liked using it to crop photos and perform touch-up work in Photoshop Touch, which Samsung throws in for free. The tablet includes a program that points you towards pen-friendly programs in Google's Play store; most of the ones I tried didn't support pressure sensitivity, but the S Pen is still a plus in any program that involves handwritten note-taking, sketching or any gesture that's tough to perform accurately with a fingertip.

Pen aside, this is one of the best big-screen Android tablets I've tried, a nicely-styled 1.3-pound package that's a skosh lighter than an iPad and doesn't look too much like an iPad clone. (Samsung, presumably, would like to minimize the future time it spends squabbling with Apple in court.)

<a href="http://www.cnn.com/2012/08/03/tech/mobile/apple-samsung-trial-peek/index.html" target="_blank">Trial gives sneak peek into Apple's inner workings</a>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Sears Reviews to the Rescue</title>
		<link>http://uxint-sears/community/general/buying-headphones/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 20 Aug 2012 14:33:01 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://uxint-sears/community/?p=342</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a name="top"></a>
<div>
<h1>Headphones buying guide - Sears Reviews</h1>
</div>
<h2>Big or small: choose a form factor<a href="http://uxint-sears/community/files/2012/08/41zwCvkdxYL._SL500_AA300_.jpg"><img class="alignleft" src="http://uxint-sears/community/files/2012/08/41zwCvkdxYL._SL500_AA300_.jpg" alt="Buying Headphones?" width="300" height="300" /></a></h2>
A long, long time ago, before the Age of the Walkman came along and revolutionized them in the 1980s, headphones were big and clunky. In those bygone days, headphones were stay-at-home things, relegated to late-night, LP music listening. That was then; the latest generation of slimmed-down headphones injects high-resolution music or home-theater sound directly into your ears.

The distinctions of portable and home headphones are melting away, but the following rundown of headphone types will clarify your buying options. How you intend to use your headphones--for music, home theater, or gaming--and where you plan to do your listening--at home or on the go--will narrow the range of possible types you'll want to research. The four major form factors are listed below, from the smallest (or most portable) to the largest, which are the least portable.

There's no wrong headphone style; whether you prefer snug-fitting earbuds or full-size, padded ear-cup models is a matter of personal preference. Choose the one that best fits your needs and your idea of comfort.

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Gardening like a grandma</title>
		<link>http://uxint-sears/community/lawn-garden/gardening-like-a-grandma/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 20 Aug 2012 23:39:55 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://uxint-sears/community/?p=518</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div>For years, most of us have dutifully applied<a href="http://www.kmart.com/shc/s/p_10151_10104_015V002112729000P?vName=Beauty&amp;cName=Sun+Care&amp;sName=Sunscreen&amp;prdNo=3&amp;blockNo=3&amp;blockType=G3&amp;sid=MMLxarticlexmerch" target="_blank">sunscreen</a>before heading outdoors, confident that we were doing the right thing to<a href="http://www.managemylife.com/mmh/projects/avoid_skin_damage?intcmp=clink">protect our skin</a>from sunburn, premature aging and skin cancer. But research is casting doubt on the ability of sunscreens to do much more than stop sunburn, and some studies have found that ingredients in certain sunscreens might actually lead to greater sun damage. Knowing what to look for in sunscreen  and what to avoid  can help you find a product that protects your skin without unwanted side effects.</div>
&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Advice from a mechanic</title>
		<link>http://uxint-sears/community/general/advice-from-a-mechanic/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 21 Aug 2012 20:03:15 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://uxint-sears/community/?p=600</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[As the seasons change, we are subjected to the various elements that will commonly damage your vehicle's health. Here are a few things that you can check every so often to keep your vehicle in tip-top shape:

Work and Performed Benefits
1. Start unit is essential to check operating efficiencies and comfort conditions.
2. Inspect flue and diverter Ensures safe operation. Flue pipe corrosion or leaks are dangerous.
3. Clean interior of vestibule will provide safety.
4. Clean pilot assembly will saves money.
5. Adjust pilot saves unnecessary &amp; costly service calls.
6. Check thermocouple will provide safety and helps prevent costly emergency service calls.
7. Clean burners, because dirty burners prevent gas from being burned properly &amp; efficiently.
8. Adjust burners, as they will increase efficiency &amp; fuel savings.
9. Set gas manifold gas pressure will provides safety, helps prevent costly repairs .
10. Set burner air adjustment. It is important to have a properly adjusted furnace for fuel economy and system effectiveness otherwise useful heat that you have paid for goes up the flue.
11. Check gas valve operation. Provides safety and prevents costly emergency service calls.
12. Test for gas leaks. Safety check.
13. Check thermostat. Defective or improperly calibrated thermostat affects comfort and operating costs.
14. Check heat anticipator. Promotes comfort in home; helps prevent costly service calls.
15. Check thermostat contacts. Saves money; increases comfort.
16. Check safety devices. Inoperative safety controls can cause dangerous problems.
17. Check fan control. When properly set, avoids wasting heat and improves comfort conditions.
18. Check limit control. Keeps unit in safe operating condition.
19. Inspect heat exchanger for leaks Safety check for possibility of creating carbon monoxide
20. Inspect combustion chamber. Saves money on fuel bills and promote safety and helps eliminate expensive repair.
21. Check blower wheel. A clean blower lengthens motor life.
22. Check blower motor and lube. Extends life, saves money, prevents failure.
23. Check for belt tension and align. Avoids costly service calls, saves money on utility costs.
24. Check and secure all panels. Newer systems have a blower door safety switch and will not operate if door is not properly in place.
25. Check air filter. Dirty air filters increase operating costs.
26. Check furnace wiring. Extends life of system, ensures safety.
27. Check noise and vibration levels. Increases comfort, can extend life of system.
28. Check for combustible materials around furnace. Keeps the unit in safe operating condition.
29. Check for combustion air. Blocked or restricted combustion air openings can be dangerous.
30. Make final operation test. To make certain that everything is working just the way it should.
31. Advise improvements if needed It allows you to gauge effectiveness, efficiency and potential need for repair or replacement.
32. Check temperature difference of supply &amp; return air temperatures. Temperature difference indicates production and capacity of unit. Also affects comfort level.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Guide to Grilling</title>
		<link>http://uxint-sears/community/general/guide-to-grilling/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 21 Aug 2012 20:16:35 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://uxint-sears/community/?p=607</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Grilling brings us back to the primitive origins of cuisine and provides an opportunity to enjoy the outdoors, friends and fine food all at once. Historically, the grill or fire pit has held an important place in virtually every country and culture. In our busy, modern lives, grilling celebrates the delightful simplicity and naturally bold flavors that whole food provides, and allows us to explore flavors of the world without leaving our own backyards.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>guide-to-grilling</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>

	<item>
		<title>Improve your health</title>
		<link>http://uxint-sears/community/fitness-sports/improve-your-health/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 22 Aug 2012 15:43:16 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://uxint-sears/community/?p=708</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div>Ellipticals Trainers Build Stamina, Endurance and a Strong Cardiovascular System</div>
<div>

You can use elliptical trainers to improve your health. NordicTrack and Sole trainers help you tone your body, burn calories and increase your cardiovascular health. At Sears, you can find hundreds of ellipticals and accessories to build your endurance and stamina.

The use of elliptical trainers takes the stress off your feet as you walk. Jogging and speed-walking can cause pain in your lower body, especially the heels and arches of your feet. If you do suffer from heel pain from constant walking, you can relieve the pain by using a Fellowes or JB International<a title="Foot Rockers" href="http://www.sears.com/search=foot+rockers?vName=">foot rocker</a>. Use the rocker to stretch your foot and to reduce heel, arch and lower body pain.

In fact, you should stretch your muscles before engaging in any activity on the elliptical. Using a<a title="Bean Exercisers" href="http://www.sears.com/search=bean+exercisers?vName=Fitness+%26+Sports&amp;viewItems=25&amp;autoRedirect=true&amp;prop17=bean%20exercisers">bean exerciser</a>, you can effectively stretch all of the muscles in your body with a few simple routines. Stretching before a workout can reduce the risk of muscle injuries such as rips, tears and pulls.

<a title="Elliptical Mats" href="http://www.sears.com/search=elliptical+mats?vName=Fitness+%26+Sports&amp;viewItems=25&amp;autoRedirect=true&amp;prop17=elliptical%20mats">Elliptical mats</a>are useful because they create an extra cushion between you, the machine and the floor. In addition, a Kamway or SportsArt bike mat keeps the elliptical from slipping as you exercise, and it also prevents the machine from scratching the floor.

Elliptical trainers are important machines for any workout room. To get the maximum results from your workout, you need the right elliptical and accessories. Shop Sears for affordable elliptical trainers and supplies to give you an edge in your training.

</div>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Alice speaks to Cheshire Cat</title>
		<link>http://uxint-sears/community/general/alice-speaks-to-cheshire-cat/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 12 Sep 2012 17:21:50 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://uxint-sears/community/?p=1805</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[`That depends a good deal on where you want to get to,' said the Cat.

`I don't much care where--' said Alice.

`Then it doesn't matter which way you go,' said the Cat.

`--so long as I get<em>somewhere</em>,' Alice added as an explanation.

`Oh, you're sure to do that,' said the Cat, `if you only walk long enough.'

Alice felt that this could not be denied, so she tried another question. `What sort of people live about here?'

`In<em>that</em>direction,' the Cat said, waving its right paw round, `lives a Hatter: and in<em>that</em>direction,' waving the other paw, `lives a March Hare. Visit either you like: they're both mad.'

`But I don't want to go among mad people,' Alice remarked.

`Oh, you can't help that,' said the Cat: `we're all mad here. I'm mad. You're mad.'

`How do you know I'm mad?' said Alice.

`You must be,' said the Cat, `or you wouldn't have come here.'

Alice didn't think that proved it at all; however, she went on `And how do you know that you're mad?'

`To begin with,' said the Cat, `a dog's not mad. You grant that?'

`I suppose so,' said Alice.

`Well, then,' the Cat went on, `you see, a dog growls when it's angry, and wags its tail when it's pleased. Now I growl when I'm pleased, and wag my tail when I'm angry. Therefore I'm mad.'

`I call it purring, not growling,' said Alice.

`Call it what you like,' said the Cat. `Do you play croquet with the Queen to-day?'

`I should like it very much,' said Alice, `but I haven't been invited yet.'

`You'll see me there,' said the Cat, and vanished.

Alice was not much surprised at this, she was getting so used to queer things happening. While she was looking at the place where it had been, it suddenly appeared again.

`By-the-bye, what became of the baby?' said the Cat. `I'd nearly forgotten to ask.'

`It turned into a pig,' Alice quietly said, just as if it had come back in a natural way.

`I thought it would,' said the Cat, and vanished again.

Alice waited a little, half expecting to see it again, but it did not appear, and after a minute or two she walked on in the direction in which the March Hare was said to live. `I've seen hatters before,' she said to herself; `the March Hare will be much the most interesting, and perhaps as this is May it won't be raving mad--at least not so mad as it was in March.' As she said this, she looked up, and there was the Cat again, sitting on a branch of a tree.

`Did you say pig, or fig?' said the Cat.

`I said pig,' replied Alice; `and I wish you wouldn't keep appearing and vanishing so suddenly: you make one quite giddy.'

`All right,' said the Cat; and this time it vanished quite slowly, beginning with the end of the tail, and ending with the grin, which remained some time after the rest of it had gone.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Finding a Safe Sunscreen</title>
		<link>http://uxint-sears/community/general/home-improvement/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 15 Aug 2012 20:09:11 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://uxint-sears/community/?p=60</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div>
<h1></h1>
July 10, 2012 | <a href="http://www.mysears.com/mysears_blog/Tips-and-How-Tos---Everyday-Living">Tips and How Tos - Everyday Living</a> | <a href="http://www.mysears.com/mysears_blog/Finding-a-Safe-Sunscreen#comments">2 comments</a>
<div><a title="NiviK" href="http://www.mysears.com/aboutme/NiviK" rel="noindex,nofollow"><img src="http://www.mysears.com/images/review/2012/165/14/1339616054-173526_cropped.jpg?1339616054" alt="photo of NiviK" /></a>
<div><a href="http://www.mysears.com/aboutme/NiviK">NiviK</a> Chicago, IL <a href="http://www.mysears.com/help#community_manager_mysears" rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.mysears.com/mysears/images/features/badges/community_manager_mysears.png?e550bee?e550bee?e550bee" alt=" Community Manager (MySears) " /></a></div>
</div>
tags: <a href="http://www.mysears.com/mysears_blog/tags/sears">sears</a>, <a href="http://www.mysears.com/mysears_blog/tags/sunscreen">sunscreen</a>, <a href="http://www.mysears.com/mysears_blog/tags/summer%20care">summer care</a>, <a href="http://www.mysears.com/mysears_blog/tags/Sun%20Protection">Sun Protection</a>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div></div>
</div>
</div>


</div>
</div>
<div>

<em>by Colleen Clark</em>
<div>
<div>For years, most of us have dutifully applied<a href="http://www.kmart.com/shc/s/p_10151_10104_015V002112729000P?vName=Beauty&amp;cName=Sun+Care&amp;sName=Sunscreen&amp;prdNo=3&amp;blockNo=3&amp;blockType=G3&amp;sid=MMLxarticlexmerch" target="_blank">sunscreen</a>before heading outdoors, confident that we were doing the right thing to<a href="http://www.managemylife.com/mmh/projects/avoid_skin_damage?intcmp=clink">protect our skin</a>from sunburn, premature aging and skin cancer. But research is casting doubt on the ability of sunscreens to do much more than stop sunburn, and some studies have found that ingredients in certain sunscreens might actually lead to greater sun damage.</div>
Knowing what to look for in sunscreen  and what to avoid  can help you find a product that protects your skin without unwanted side effects.
<h2>Truths about Sunscreen</h2>
<img src="http://www.mysears.com/managed_images/8572/original/sunscreen.JPG?1341870709" alt="" width="170" height="255" />Yes, sunscreen prevents sunburn, but, surprisingly, that's about it, according to recent research. Here are the facts to counter some common misconceptions:

<strong>Sunscreens aren't proven to prevent skin cancer or premature aging</strong>. A<a href="http://www.fda.gov/OHRMS/DOCKETS/98fr/07-4131.htm" target="_blank">2007 Food and Drug Administration (FDA) review of scientific literature</a>led the agency to conclude that "FDA does not believe, as a whole, that the studies demonstrate that sunscreens alone help prevent skin aging or skin cancer."

<strong>SPF numbers above 50 aren't reliable</strong>. The same 2007 FDA report found that SPF ratings greater than 50 are misleading because tests are inconclusive as to whether they block out a higher percentage of the sun's rays than lower-rated products. The FDA took a similar position in 1999 about SPFs higher than 30, until results demonstrated that SPF ratings between 30 and 50 were reliable.

<strong>Some sunscreen ingredients can promote skin damage</strong>. FDA research has shown that vitamin A, when exposed to sunlight, can increase the development of tumors in test animals. Vitamin A is a common ingredient in sunscreens because it decreases the signs of aging.

In addition, some sunscreen ingredients release skin-damaging free radicals as the ingredients break down. Using enough sunscreen and reapplying helps prevent this problem, but few people use enough sunscreen, or reapply often enough.

<strong>A little sun without sunscreen is good for you</strong>. Sunlight reacts with a pigment in the skin to produce vitamin D, a process that sunscreen seems to inhibit. Vitamin D is essential to good health  it strengthens bones and the immune system, among other benefits. The best way to get enough vitamin D is under debate in the medical community, but the American Medical Association recommends exposing the skin to 10 minutes a day of sun without sunscreen.
<h2>What to Avoid in Sunscreen</h2>
The<a href="http://www.ewg.org/2010sunscreen/" target="_blank">2010 Sunscreen Guide</a>by the Environmental Working Group found that only 39 of the 1,400 sunscreens it evaluated provided protection against<a href="http://www.managemylife.com/mmh/questions/190958-whats-the-difference-between-uvb-radiation-and-uva-radiation?intcmp=clink">UVA and UVB rays</a>and contained no ingredients the group considers unsafe.
<h3>Ingredients</h3>
Watch out for these unsafe ingredients:

<strong>Oxybenzone</strong>has been linked to allergies, hormone disruption and cell damage.

<strong>Vitamin A</strong>has been linked to skin cancer. You might see it listed as retinyl palmitate, which is a synthetic form of vitamin A.

<strong>Insect repellent.</strong>The chemicals that make sunscreens penetrate the skin also allow the pesticides in insect repellent to be absorbed. If you absolutely need insect repellent, apply it separately after the sunscreen dries.
<h3>Formulation</h3>
Sprays and powders (such as cosmetic powders) disperse particles into the air, where you can inhale them. Even sunscreen ingredients that are safe when applied as a cream  such as zinc oxide and titanium dioxide  can be hazardous when inhaled.
<h3>SPF</h3>
Until the FDA determines that ratings over SPF 50 are reliable, stick to something between 30 and 50.
<h2>What You Want in Sunscreen</h2>
<img src="http://content.managemyhome.com/Images/articles/sunscreen-and-hat.jpg" alt="Sun protection" width="190" border="0" />
<h3>Ingredients</h3>
Choose ingredients that protect against UVA rays, which have been linked to premature aging and skin cancer, as well as UVB, which cause burning. Those ingredients include the minerals zinc oxide and titanium dioxide, which sit on the skin rather than being absorbed; avobenzone; and Mexoryl SX, which isn't widely used.
<h3>Formulation</h3>
A cream, gel or stick formulation is safer than a spray or powder because there's less risk of inhaling the product.
<h3>SPF</h3>
The SPF rating indicates how well a sunscreen deflects UVB rays. SPF 15 filters out 93 percent of the UVB rays; SPF 30 filters 97percent; and SPF 50 filters 98 percent.

Most dermatologists recommend using at least SPF 30, year round.
<h2>Getting the Most from Your Sunscreen</h2>
<strong>Apply early</strong>. Apply sunscreen about half an hour before sun exposure, so the sunscreen has time to bind to the skin.

<strong>Use enough</strong>. Most people don't apply nearly enough sunscreen. The recommended amount is 1 ounce for an average-sized adult. That's about as much as a shot glass holds.

<strong>Reapply often</strong>. Don't let that SPF 50 make you complacent about reapplying. Even a waterproof sunscreen wears off if you sweat or swim. Reapply a full amount at least every two hours. If you're swimming or sweating a lot, reapply more often.
<h2>Sun Protection Beyond Sunscreen</h2>
Don't get the idea that you should cut out sunscreen all together. Choose sunscreen wisely and remember that it isnt the only sun protection you need. Here is a list of other things to do to protect yourself from the sun:

<strong>Wear protective clothing</strong>. It may be summer, but wearing lightweight long-sleeved shirts and pants helps block the sun's UV rays. A large-brimmed hat protects your face.

<strong>Relax in the shade</strong>. Either find natural shade under a tree or make your own with an umbrella or canopy.

<strong>Don't go out in peak sun hours</strong>. Avoid the sun between the hours of 10 am and 2 pm, when the sun is directly overhead. The best time to be outdoors is either in the early morning or the late afternoon, when the sun is lower in the sky.

<strong>Always wear sunglasses</strong>. Get<a href="http://www.managemylife.com/mmh/questions/156353-expensive-sunglasses-cheap-ones?intcmp=clink">sunglasses</a>that block UV rays to protect your eyes when outdoors and when driving. Not only does squinting cause wrinkles, but UV rays can cause cataracts.

</div>
</div>]]></content:encoded>

<div>December 15, 2011</div>
<div>
<h1>Oven light stays on for kenmore Electric range.</h1>
I recently bought a used Kenmore Smooth top electric range. I replaced the light bulb and the light stays on all the time? I did some research and not sure if its the door hinges. The door does close but not perfectly. thanks. Model number 79096322401. I called Sears and it was made in 2003 or 2004

</div>
</div>
<div></div>
<div>
<div>
<div>

	<li><a href="http://www.managemylife.com/mmh/questions/247230-light-oven-stays" target="_self"> http://www.managemylife.com/mmh/questions/247230-light-ov...</a></li>

<div>

Sam a

Expert

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div>

<a href="http://www.managemylife.com/mmh/user_profile/28043/sam">Sam A</a> EXPERT December 19, 2011

Thank you for your question, on the oven light not going out with the oven door closed.

Yes! There was a service issue with the hinges not letting the door close enough to turn the light off.

It will require replacement of the oven door hinges.

The part number for the hinge kit is: 5304445529.

Here is the ordering information for replacing the hinges for the oven door below.

<a href="http://www.searspartsdirect.com/partsdirect/part-number/5304445529/0022/628&amp;pathTaken=partSearch&amp;blt=14&amp;prst=0&amp;shdPart=5304445529?sid=MMLxexpertxmerch">Hinge kit for oven door </a> .

There are instructions in the kit that show how to replace the new hinge kit.

Please let me know how it goes.

Sam A.

</div>
</div>
<div></div>
</div>

<div>

<a href="http://www.managemylife.com/mmh/user_profile/2200654995/tim">navyflipper</a> March 12, 2012

hi, i have a Kenmore # 665.95775890 electric smooth top. i went to use the oven last night. instead of hitting the broiler button, to cook hamburgers, i hit the clean button, an the oven door was open. i tried hit broiler button and close the door, but by then the latch had moved to the right to lock the door, an the door wasn't closed.now i cant use the oven cause door wont close cause the latch wont move back to the left.it shows a code, E1-F5- an says to call for service, that the latch may need replacing,is there any way I can reset it on my own? i cant afford service right now

</div>
</div>
<div></div>
</div>
<div>
<div>
<div>

5 1 Ratings

</div>
<div><a>Rate this!</a> <a title="1 star out of 5">1</a><a title="2 stars out of 5"> 2</a><a title="3 stars out of 5"> 3</a><a title="4 stars out of 5"> 4</a><a title="5 stars out of 5"> 5</a></div>
</div>
<div>
<div>
<div><a href="http://www.managemylife.com/mmh/user_profile/28043/sam"><img src="http://www.managemylife.com/images/2956/small/Sam_IMG_2179_small.jpg?1288964544" alt="" border="0" /></a>
<div>

Sam a

Expert

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div>

<a href="http://www.managemylife.com/mmh/user_profile/28043/sam">Sam A</a> EXPERT March 13, 2012

Hello Tim! I would suggest that you try this and let me know if it worked. Open the oven door and push and hold the oven light switch button all the while you program the oven to self clean. After programming the range to the self-clean cycle wait 30 seconds and the cancel the self clean cycle, still holding in the oven door light switch another 30 seconds. This will simulate the oven door being closed. This should get the latch hook back to the home position and the error code should go away. You should know be able to operate the range normally. Please let me know how it went. Sam A.

</div>
</div>
<div></div>
</div>
<div>
<div>
<div>

0 0 Ratings

2nd posting,I didnt see my 1st post, so resending....Hello Sam A, I read ur advice. Went to the stove an hit the off/cancel button to reset back to the clock, like it was before, I pushed the oven light switch, an went to push the clean button an heard a grinding sound an looked down an the latch was moving back to its home position. So simple its stupid...i have my stove back..I have my own Plumbing Service, an give lots of advice to save them a Service call, I lose money, but I gain a happy customer an maybe future jobs. Im glad thats happened to me,for once. THANK again, Tim from TJ Plumbing Services in Co. If u have a Plumbing Question, Email me. I'll do my best to help You

<h1>Easter dinner</h1>
<ul>
	<li>
<div>
<div>
<div></div>
</div>
</div></li>
	<li></li>
	<li><a title="RSS feed for Easter dinner" href="http://www.mysears.com/discussion_boards/Community/topics/Easter-dinner-0/posts/rss" rel="nofollow">subscribe to feed</a></li>
	<li></li>
</ul>

<div><a title="JulieK" href="http://www.mysears.com/aboutme/JulieK" rel="noindex,nofollow"><img src="http://www.mysears.com/images/review/2011/265/10/1316707074-636287_cropped.jpg?1318552681" alt="photo of JulieK" /></a>
<div><a href="http://www.mysears.com/aboutme/JulieK">JulieK</a> Chicago, IL posts: 8387 <a href="http://www.mysears.com/help#moderator_mysears" rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.mysears.com/mysears/images/features/badges/moderator_mysears.png?e550bee?e550bee?e550bee" alt=" Moderator (MySears) " /></a></div>

<div>posted on March 25, 2012 at 08:40AM <a href="http://www.mysears.com/discussion_boards/Community/topics/Easter-dinner-0/posts#">Inappropriate?</a> <img src="http://www.mysears.com/images/comment_tail.gif?e550bee" alt="" /></div>
<div>
<div>

For those who celebrate, what do you normally have for Easter dinner/lunch? We used to have a roasted ham every year, but lately, my sister-in-law has been making lamb.

We literally spend the day eating, and then end with this huge meal! Always leave full for days!

</div>
</div>

<strong>Hi Juliek, it is nice to see a happy post so to speak ... We had leg of lamb last year and it was nicely paired with red potatoes, carrots, and a few other assorted dishes.</strong>

<div></div>
<strong>Our frigidair oven has a selection for "Jewish Holidays" but a kosher meat is usually ham, right? </strong>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div>
<div>
<div><a title="Billfish" href="http://www.mysears.com/aboutme/Billfish" rel="noindex,nofollow"><img src="http://www.mysears.com/images/review/2012/41/18/1328921651-726207_cropped.jpg?1328921652" alt="photo of Billfish" /></a>

<div>
<div></div>
Ham is never kosher.Lamb can be,if it is properly butchered.I think the thing with the Jewish Holidays setting is that Jewish folks aren't allowed to operate the range on these holidays,so it allows you to make your settings the day before.Thus you can have hot food on the holiday without actually operating the oven on the holiday.

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div>

Hope everyone has great long weekend!

<div>In response to <a href="http://www.mysears.com/aboutme/BigMike4511">BigMike4511</a>'s post from May 25 2012 10:19PM</div>
Yes. There is a bonfire. But not until later in the day as the weather has been way too hot to have one earlier. There will be multiple grills going too. I had to buy a new tent though, as I could not locate my tent poles and for the size I have/need it would be more expensive to purchase replacement poles than a new tent.

</div>
</div>

<div></div>
I'm just spending a nice quiet weekend in the country, 'Course since I live in the country, I enjoy every day in the country! I have been surprised at how much the price of gas has declined here at a holiday. Locally it is $3.40 a gal. That's about a 50 cent drop in about two months. I generally stay pretty close to home on holidays and do any traveling at other times. Friday I drove about five miles on the interstate near the house and it looked like rush hour in the city!

</div>

<h1>Gas Prices</h1>
<ul>
	<li>
<div>
<div>
<div></div>
</div>
</div></li>

<div><a href="http://www.mysears.com/aboutme/lindiloo">lindiloo</a> Glen Ellyn, IL posts: 278 <a href="http://www.mysears.com/help#levels" rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.mysears.com/mysears/images/features/badges/2012_contributors_circle_2.png?e550bee?e550bee?e550bee" alt="2012 Contributors Circle " /></a></div>

<div>posted on March 26, 2012 at 08:56PM <a href="http://www.mysears.com/discussion_boards/Community/topics/Gas-Prices-1/posts#">Inappropriate?</a> <img src="http://www.mysears.com/images/comment_tail.gif?e550bee" alt="" /></div>
<div>
<div>

How much do you pay for gas? My local gas station is now selling gas for $4.55 a gallon. Yesterday, I dropped my son off at college and was able to fill up on Highway 57, about 100 miles away for $3.84. That seems like a mighty big difference.

</div>
</div>

<strong>The price of crude could be as cheap as one dollar a barrell upon tapping uncharted fields in Iraq. Perhaps, it is a bit scarey to think of a revolutionary guard actually allowing a muslim shiite population an advantage over Iran. Sunni's could trade water if Austria would give them a glass with ice and I'm sure gas could be cheaper folks, but to often sustainable society's take more time than what is anticipated. 2018 seems like a long way into the future for most but when your incorperating a commodity which the world depends on its a few hours from now. Foreign policy develops at a slugs pace when she wants to move forward..... I suppose on a local level, vendors have "fixed" prices.</strong>

<div></div>
<strong>Another way to look at the cost of fuel for your car is to compare it to coffee. This is by far my favorite anylogy, in 1993 regular was around .95 cents a gallon while super was 1.15 a gallon. We use to pump gas, (between the flux of traffic), and fetch a cup of jo from wawa for roughly the cost of one gallon. Now, you may say, those days are so far gone but I challenge you to do the math. Those days could be coming back! My problem is the fact that starbucks is my choice to get up and go... (and wawa now gives me bad gas). Some say America runs on Dunkin; however, we are failing to see equality with the arabic bean.</strong>

</div>

<div><a href="http://www.mysears.com/aboutme/inquisitivemind">inquisitivemind</a> Portland, OR <a href="http://www.mysears.com/help#levels" rel="nofollow"><img src="http://www.mysears.com/mysears/images/features/badges/2010_friends_circle_1.png?e550bee?e550bee?e550bee" alt="2010 Friends Circle " /></a></div>

<div>
<div>posted on March 30, 2012 at 05:59AM</div>
<ul>
	<li></li>
	<li></li>
	<li></li>
	<li></li>
	<li><a href="http://www.mysears.com/discussion_boards/Community/topics/Gas-Prices-1/posts#">Inappropriate?</a></li>
</ul>
</div>
<div>
<div></div>
Wait until you are paying the same sort of prices that the Europeans, and a few other nations are paying. I know a large proportion of the European prices are taxes but again wait untilthe political leaders,ortheir successors, realise that their is a largely untapped tax goldmine 'out there'.

One other thing approximately 30% of US oil imports come from Canada and Mexico, one of these days those two nations are going to wake up and realise they could get more for their oil on the world wide market than by selling it to their neighbour. There is currently about a $20/barrel premium on the 'Brent Crude' benchmark than on the WTI bench mark. I know there are other factors 'out there' but that is, in my opinion, a real big one.

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div>
<div>
<h1>Craftsman Yard Tractor Model 917.254310</h1>
My Craftsman tractor has served me well for 24 years. This week I was using it and stopped to hose off some dirt and then it wouldn't restart but did turn over just fine. I took off the hood, checked the spark plug wires (plugs were new this spring), removed the air filter and when I turned it over I could see it was getting gas. I then noticed that the outer edge of the fly wheel was very rusty so I cleaned it with a light wire brush. I checked for loose wires and after taking a break for lunch I tried to start it and it started right away. Yesterday I filled it with fresh gas and it started right away. I was mowing the lawn and all of the sudden it just died. No chugging popping or anything else it just quit and wouldn't restart. Since I couldnt push it back up the hill to my shop I covered it for the night. I went out this morning and it immediately started. I drove it into the shop with no trouble. It seems like it has to warm up before it dies. I know there are 3 safety switches on the tractor that will prevent it from starting and I wonder if one or more of those might be bad. Can anyone tell me what might be causing this?

</div>
</div>
<div></div>
<div>
<div>
<div>

3 1 Ratings

</div>

If you decide to schedule service and have a qualified technician help you, I have also attached a link to Searshomeservices.com. I hope these links will help until your expert can respond. I have a feeling you can handle the repair just fine with a little help from your expert.
